Transformative Neuroradiology Services

As a leading spine and brain imaging center, our neuroradiology services cater to a wide range of clients, from research centers and medical centers to professional attorneys needing expert neutral witnesses who understand the case's subject matter and provide without fear or favor witnesses. At Neuro Experts, PC, we excel in spine and brain imaging diagnostics to offer precise evaluation for conditions such as traumatic brain injury, spine injury, brain tumors, multiple sclerosis, and epilepsy.

From diagnosing complex neuroradiological conditions to offering results promptly, we take pride in delivering quality images and actionable insights for all our clients.

Why choose us?

Comprehensive, unbiased, and precise evaluation of a wide range of disorders such as traumatic brain injury, spine injury, brain tumors, multiple sclerosis, and epilepsy.

‚úì

Board-certified experts with extensive experience in medical imaging and clinical research consulting.

‚úì

Comprehensive, unbiased interpretation across CT, PET, SPECT, MRI, DTI, functional MRI, MR perfusion, and MR spectroscopy, plus volumetric analysis (NeuroQuant, icometrix, etc.).

‚úì

Trusted and impartial California radiologist trauma, accident, and worker's compensation consulting and expert witness services.

‚úì

Quick, 24-48 hour turnaround times for reports.

‚úì

Complimentary initial consultation.

Clinical focus areas

We support evaluations across traumatic brain injury, spine trauma, tumors, multiple sclerosis, epilepsy, dementia, and neurodegenerative disorders. Our reports are built for clinical clarity and courtroom defensibility.

  • TBI + spine trauma
  • Neurodegenerative disease
  • Tumors + epilepsy
  • Multiple sclerosis

Modalities we interpret

  • CT, MRI, DTI, fMRI, PET, SPECT, MR perfusion, and spectroscopy.
  • Volumetric analysis tools such as NeuroQuant and icometrix.
Need a second opinion? We can review imaging protocols and deliver defensible findings fast.

How we work

Clear steps, disciplined workflow, and transparent communication at every stage.

Intake + case scoping

We review your imaging goals, timeline, and context to define deliverables.

Expert review

Senior neuroradiologists conduct a rigorous, modality-specific analysis.

Clear reporting

We deliver concise findings, visuals, and recommendations tailored to your audience.

Ongoing support

Follow-up consults and testimony support to keep your team aligned.

Expertise you can trust

Our team isn't just skilled; they are dedicated to making complex imaging and consulting feel simple and approachable.

Our team of neuroradiology experts have fellowship training and board certification from prestigious institutions like Harvard University, USC, and the American Board of Radiology. So, when you reach out to us, you get trusted and just medico-legal guidance without any discrepancies. From DTI and DBI analysis to other disorders like stroke, tumors, and spine trauma, our neuroradiology professionals can go beyond traditional diagnostic methods and offer a holistic understanding of the conditions at hand to support cases of malpractice or support individuals in getting fair compensation in injury/accident cases.

After thorough neuroradiological evaluations and compiling accurate reports, our experts also deliver unbiased, clear, and concise courtroom testimony to support the case. With years of experience in the field, we can present intricate medical evidence in understandable language so the jury and legal professionals can comprehend medical facts in criminal and civil cases.

To help researchers achieve breakthroughs in evidence-based medical evaluations, we offer neuroradiology research and clinical trial consulting services to combine advanced medical knowledge with clinical neurosciences. Backed by years of research experience in neuroradiology, our experts can aid research institutions studying disorders like epilepsy, dementia, AD/ADRD, cerebral small vessel ischemic diseases, stroke, TBI, spine trauma, and other neurodegenerative disorders.

With our understanding of technologies like fMRI, DTI, SPECT, MRI, CT, and PET, we can aid clinical researchers in assessing and diagnosing conditions related to the spine, brain, and nervous system. Our reliable professionals can ensure the reasonableness of the research hypothesis and plan, increasing the likelihood of securing grant funding and reaching the research project's specific aims.

Medical-legal consulting

Defensible imaging review and reporting for malpractice, injury, and disputed diagnostics.

Expert witness support

Clear, concise testimony and exhibits that help juries understand complex evidence.

Clinical research consulting

Evidence-based guidance for trials in epilepsy, dementia, stroke, TBI, and neurodegeneration.
